decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. It includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces, as well as versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent for additional threats. The deck also features a small planeswalker subtheme with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student providing card advantage and Atraxa, Grand Unifier for additional synergy with the reanimation strategy.

This deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's mana base by using cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon while also ramping up quickly with Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide, and Ancient Tomb. It then closes out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Fury, Broadside Bombardiers, and Pyrogoyf, backed by powerful removal spells like Sundering Eruption. The focus is on putting pressure on the opponent early and maintaining control of the board until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through various removal spells and disruptive creatures while also using the Aether Vial to quickly deploy creatures onto the battlefield. It includes a combination of powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to search for key pieces like Kaldra Compleat and powerful equipment. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value through blinking creatures like Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and disruptive creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize a combination of fast mana acceleration, card selection, and graveyard recursion to quickly assemble and execute a game-winning combo. By using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck into the graveyard, the player aims to create a situation where cards like Narcomoeba and Dread Return can be used to bring back powerful creatures and win the game on the spot. The deck heavily relies on powerful spells like Pact of Negation and Dark Ritual to enable this combo and protect it from disruption.

This deck focuses on early aggression and disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void. It aims to have a fast start using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to play threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Seasoned Dungeoneer quickly. The combination of cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors allows for explosive plays, while Cavern of Souls ensures that creatures can't be countered. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while limiting their options through disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes cards for mana denial and tempo control, such as Back to Basics and Magus of the Moon. The deck aims to stabilize the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. With a mix of permission spells and efficient answers, it seeks to control the game's pace and ultimately come out on top through superior card advantage and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library. This combo is supported by cards like Goblin Welder, Goblin Engineer, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and other artifacts help to support the combo and generate mana. Additionally, there are some control elements with Red Elemental Blast, Pyroblast, and Lightning Bolt to deal with opponent's threats. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on using Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck can generate mana quickly with cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, while utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mox Opal provide additional utility and efficiency to the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures onto the battlefield by using Show and Tell and Sneak Attack, allowing for a fast win condition through Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Griselbrand. The deck also includes protection and card draw spells to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and win the game before they have a chance to mount a defense. The deck has a strong focus on efficiency and speed, aiming to end the game in just a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive Eldrazi creatures using mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while also applying pressure with powerful creatures such as Reality Smasher and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the Eldrazi theme, with lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple helping to cast the deck's larger threats earlier in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with efficient removal and disruption spells. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Dauthi Voidwalker provides card advantage and graveyard interaction, while Orcish Bowmasters and Cecil, Dark Knight offer additional threats to pressure your opponent. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game while closing out the match with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck revolves around using Doomsday in combination with various cards to set up a winning condition, typically involving Thassa's Oracle. It aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Flusterstorm. The inclusion of Personal Tutor and Edge of Autumn helps with consistency, while cards like Force of Will are used for protection. The deck utilizes various fetchlands and cantrips to manipulate the top of the library and draw into the necessary combo pieces efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck includes cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to control the opponent's hand and spells, while utilizing Fatal Push and other removal spells to neutralize threats. Cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide additional aggression, supported by Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage. The deck also includes land disruption with Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy focuses on tempo plays and efficient removal to maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures using cards like Eldrazi Temple and Grim Monolith, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Linebreaker, backed up by removal spells like Kozilek's Command. The inclusion of cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage provide additional disruption and versatility, making it a formidable aggro deck in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and utilize cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a devastating combo. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the pace of the game, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional utility and versatility. Overall, the focus is on efficiently reanimating threats to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the game early on. The deck includes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. By using a combination of card draw with Brainstorm and control elements, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and win the game through powerful reanimated creatures.
